channel.title: Compiling Issue: XStream;
channel.description:
I've moved my server over to another computer, installed JDK 7 then thought it was that that caused the problem so I downgraded to JDK 6_26 and ever since then I get this:
[code=batch] src\com\rs2\world\XMLManager.java:9: package com.thoughtworks.xstream does not e xist import com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream; ^ src\com\rs2\world\XMLManager.java:20: cannot find symbol symbol : class XStream location: class com.rs2.world.XMLManager public static XStream xstream; ^ src\com\rs2\world\XMLManager.java:23: cannot find symbol symbol : class XStream location: class com.rs2.world.XMLManager xstream = new XStream(); ^ 3 errors Press any key to continue . . . [/code]
My server worked fine before and now I can't even run my server because all my server settings are in XML and I need to fix this before continuing.
Has the import changed or something? I know it's a valid import because 1: it worked before and 2: Google shows it's valid from other people's code, so I really don't get it. Any help?
Edit: I also had to rewrite a compiler from scratch because my current didn't work for some reason. I think it may be getting confused because I use src\com\rs2\* in every line, whereas it really should be com\rs2 and maybe that's what's the problem... here's the first line of my compiler just incase.
[code=batch] "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe" -classpath . -d bin src\com\rs2\*.java src\com\rs2\content\*.java [/code]

item.title: Compiling Issue: XStream;
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

I’ve moved my server over to another computer, installed JDK 7 then thought it was that that caused the problem so I downgraded to JDK 6_26 and ever since then I get this:

src\com\rs2\world\XMLManager.java:9: package com.thoughtworks.xstream does not e
xist
import com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream;
                               ^
src\com\rs2\world\XMLManager.java:20: cannot find symbol
symbol  : class XStream
location: class com.rs2.world.XMLManager
        public static XStream xstream;
                      ^
src\com\rs2\world\XMLManager.java:23: cannot find symbol
symbol  : class XStream
location: class com.rs2.world.XMLManager
                xstream = new XStream();
                              ^
3 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

My server worked fine before and now I can’t even run my server because all my server settings are in XML and I need to fix this before continuing.

Has the import changed or something? I know it’s a valid import because 1: it worked before and 2: Google shows it’s valid from other people’s code, so I really don’t get it. Any help?

Edit: I also had to rewrite a compiler from scratch because my current didn’t work for some reason. I think it may be getting confused because I use src\com\rs2* in every line, whereas it really should be com\rs2 and maybe that’s what’s the problem… here’s the first line of my compiler just incase.

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_26\bin\javac.exe" -classpath . -d bin src\com\rs2\*.java src\com\rs2\content\*.java

Read full topic
